intro: Cunila incisa, commonly known as narrowleaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters. Cunila incisa is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
